C909322973604E2187062C41300B1D8E.description: Know which third person or metaphoric terminologies are not used in everyday or informal expressions (poetic language vs everyday language). Knowing when to use third person language vs first person language.

348B4899DF4A42AFA8124E687FEDD299.description: Know which cultural songs or words not to use in the home or inapporpriate spaces.

94E08A59A59F4E2FA63DFB69DAC344F7.description: Know when to self proclaim and when not to.

CE7FDDDCE43040AA93131AD74E653718.description: Know when to not utilize certain verbiage and expressions.

7380DA6DE51C491C930335D28C2C153A.description: Understand the implications of what certain phrases or expressions might entail.

300A4A94E9044170AFC5995AF619A018.description: Use body language to express appropriate meanings, in context to age, gender, and situations.

19D42E1F7A0B420499A90172E62EF87A.description: Express and give remarks without sounding like you are insulting a person.

B79D273EDE034961AAAB2BBDFD75664A.description: Know appropriate vocabularies to use pertaining to gender and age.

83657730A35C439192104A9527512C99.description: Understand the implications of when to or not to compliment.

813E5871EA4140F696BA8267B3708DD7.description: Appropriate Verbiage Knowing the right time and space to express and/or not express certain phrases, thoughts, statements, etc...

DC8C133ACF1645CD95F5708B19C7FE5E.description: Know the vocabulary and grammatical nuances of how to give thanks after the completion of a culturally specific task.

A7F996BCD16F4568BC2F855769152A2D.description: Know how to ask for help from someone who might not want to express that they are skilled. - culture of humbleness and also culture of needing to be formally asked.

B898C8DF0F9442DCA3B4456CF3E53A96.description: Have the vocabulary base and understanding of how to ask for culturally specific tasks.

B207E59F694E4B08A2235DE19265B7E0.description: Be able to differentiate and express appropriate actions regarding to requests and "silent requests"...

C2B9859F7CB2489CAE53558D489AA060.description: Be able to define and understand when to express ownership of communal belongings.

9B52889F6CF645BFA61BBB1EB4682E9F.description: Knowing when to ask to use or eat something vs when not to.

CBB21C60ADED44B19E8A39C319C87FB3.description: Know when and how to ask to use something from someone (borrow), in a indirect way that is not offensive/culturally appropriate.

B252828D546B454B9AC68A7D8D3AF9AB.description: Use appropriate vocabulary and body language to request for an item or performance of a function.

2D390D495EAF424EB6B4A8E7AB789CAF.description: Requests Utilizing appropriate and correct language base for making requests, with respect to time, setting, and situation.

BA5B2B7FC08C4AE2A9B723BE142A1374.description: Understand the nuances of time context terms used to describe conditions of age

A21F80BC3F93434CB5BF9C52CF13CD89.description: Understand and able to use time context to support tenses.

9E609138B09C42D1B2130B00EB5546D4.description: Understand and be able to utilize broader meanings as time and timeframe context.

946B7384A70B45518050666C5C2BFCAC.description: Able to use the different terms for days of the week to talk about activities in different time contexts.

F0F81044964F4C6395C98B810F2F824A.description: Understand and able to use tenses to support context of activities in different timeframes.

F2E857CC600F4A8B87D3B67A520576BE.description: Able to utilize numbers and timeframe vocabularies to talk about time.

AF261D2C033141B491B7B1CD065EFE80.description: Time Context Utilizing language pertaining to time context to express tenses, timeframes, and occurrances.

B6E3347C72374D1CA941A95CDA5EB40B.description: Give formal expressions with the appropriate body langauge.

D805464BD3F44092AFB11C66CE0489D5.description: Differentiate between formal and informal words and phrases for appropriate situations

A4BC52F1EB7C4A08838C8109BBFB4B41.description: Utilize opposites to express compliments or vice versa, or knowing when to stay silent on expressing about your personal knowledge.

5A70B874BF524740862A94B1EBDFF6DB.description: Able to understand and use idioms with ease

1304542E2F7040B0A2FF5DBE5DA1A69D.description: Know the skills of accepting, requesting, and/or declining.

33A97924AD4C43AAB51369D74490BED9.description: Understand the use of expressions and terms in context to deeper or hidden meanings

A5AB716EB9D4469BBECFCF954C5CB6FD.description: L4.1.1 Able to differentiate the nuances in meanings of of everyday run-on nouns/adjectives

F8279D5369604E10AF1B8C0F80BB2011.description: High/Low Context Language The ability to perform and comprehend nuances of messages behind Hmong sayings and multi-layers of meanings ("Hmongspeak")

2AA2CE2DF5A148D38403CF98B0076D97.description: Be able to emphasizing/change tones in culturally specific sayings, phrases and/or songs.

4701EFF3E0CC4E6D8865492E87264D8F.description: Emphase words with your tone/ hands and/or body movement.

3868350CECB1463A841074FAF4595BFF.description: Able to use run on adjectives with appropriate expressives to describe one single noun or action

D75B517CEE7F4B6B95584CA5DA37DEE5.description: Know when to use the postive-negative method of expression and understanding how it changes the meaning of the discourse.

73426DFEC29A4990BA396554434A0383.description: Able to use sound elongation and intonation to express description

CBA09D8635944BBDB10FF1BA2BB14B89.description: Able to produce sentences using descriptive verbs, adverbs / utilizing expressives

C04DDD8EADAE4AF18562024E1BF16868.description: Able to verbalize and comprehend between literal/actual descriptions and situations

258AF97B19D74E6FBC48B7758F0A3231.description: Know and be able to use with ease, the vocabularies for describing the conditions of something or the state of how something is.

1439B2360CC34FFFBEC0E68A0E2CF104.description: Know when to repeat a certain adjective and/or verb and understand how it changes the meaning of the discourse.

A6D1A3A80CD948B9A4BFE88F650C6676.description: Able to describe basic feelings and emotions

8CF65DA7E9C6409F8BC840C29CA82505.description: Able to verbalize common adjectives in describing everyday nouns.

0D0A593CE8374170852C435101127F9E.description: Descriptive Language Having the vocabulary base and comprehension of grammatical structures to articulate details pertaining to context of topic.

80F4A6E48FCE40BE9253B0D44D7B3B11.description: Know the appropriate terms and tone to use when asking about culturally sensitive situations.

D1A46F39DD054970AA906A914A889CAF.description: Understand and be able to articulate well with formal terms pertaining to directions and prepositions (often shared root words with Chinese/Old Mandarin) and utilizing in appropriate contexts.

A04A4107798142798A6190929C400D7D.description: Know and understand more complex grammar pertaining to asking and giving directions, especially in the context of Hmong prepositions that reflect geographical terrains.

44FB711925494895819A17BD66953EE8.description: Know the terminologies for giving and asking for locations and basic directions.

F111DC2E84844C9B990D961B6A2581BF.description: Know when and how to use the Question Replication Method and/or the Statement Method to answer a question.

92DEED707CFE4422B00E2F62C9194732.description: Know the basic terminologies and grammatical structures to inquire about who, what, why, whan, and where of everyday interpersonal communication.

6FE3911728EA4CD5B4208427D5BA363F.description: Statements and Inquiry The ability to form and comprehend statements and ask questions pertaining to the context of discussion.

C0D80EB566DD4EF7849F40F078D4FE87.description: L1.3.2 Know family and kinship titles as well as the proper methodology of introducing someone to another person.

AA683160A802481597788F90E2599719.description: Use music, instruments, songs and other modes of communication to introduce oneself, ones presence.

D151060D3EC04C3E966F114D369D60A4.description: Understand the usage of formal greetings and addressing of "non-personal" audience vs personal - in different settings.

368527509CA9466D8DD838C56401DBAD.description: Learn the proper process of taking leave, saying farewell in formal ways.

4D413369543C4237B5AC96692C55DF58.description: Greetings and Salutations Having and understanding cultural knowledge, social-linguistic context, and vocabulary base to begin and end communication with others.
